summary:
My work & activities involve:

- Principal Investigator research group Science & Tech Entrepreneurship, Department of Physics & Astronomy, Faculty of Science, VU Amsterdam.

- Co-creating entrepreneurial innovation ecosystems through collaboration with local, national and international partners. 

- As Program Director in the lead of the Bachelor's program Science, Business & Innovation (SBI) (with NVAO Special Feature Entrepreneurship), Department of Physics & Astronomy, Faculty of Science, VU Amsterdam

-Teaching and coordinating several BSc and MSc courses & graduation trajectories on bachelor’s, master’s and honours level. 

- Providing training to science and education professionals on science and tech entrepreneurship, and impact creation for (international) researchers and research institutes.

- Owner of ScienceCreates BV, consultancy on science and tech (entrepreneurship) education.

name: Lukas De Ruiter
skills: ['langetermijnvisie', 'Interne communicatie', 'onderhandelingen en overleg', 'organizatie', 'Planning', 'lange termijn visie', 'Duurzaamheid', 'Communicatie', 'Management', 'Projectcoördinatie', 'Analytisch denkvermogen', 'Sales', 'Creatief oplossen van problemen', 'Spreken in het openbaar']
summary:
My name is Lukas de Ruiter, born in Amsterdam 30-03-2000. I'd describe myself as an empathic, creative and energetic personality. I am very eager to learn and improve myself. Throughout my youth and further development I have always been curious towards development and innovation. My interests range from arts, language, society to exact sciences and technology. I would describe myself as a generalist, using my broad interests and understanding to build bridges between different disciplines and manage teams so that individual qualities work invigoratingly. I aim to excel in whatever I do and commit to solving what challenges attain my focus.

At the moment I believe sustainability is one of the biggest challenges society has to face. Restructuring systems, re-evaluating our norms and principles and using creative solutions to solve complex issues. I find purpose in working towards this goal and inspiring others to join the effort and hope to attain tangible results in my career.

summary: My interest in tackling injustice and inequality have made me choose a very interdisciplinary academic background, which includes chemistry, international law and conflict resolution. This rather unique set of academic knowledge comes together in conflict over (access to) natural resources, varying from water to (precious/rare earth) metals, but has also proven valuable in the intrinsic interdisciplinary and complex fields of, amongst others, gender equality and sustainability. I have international work experience in the Latin Caribbean and adopted a flexible attitude, allowing me to work in very different environments varying from high level diplomacy to community based projects. I am able to connect people and build bridges. I am fluent in Dutch, English and Spanish.

summary:
Hi there! I am a full-time Data Migration Analyst with a bachelor's degree in Future Planet Studies (UvA). I have been working to obtain a strong foundation of knowledge in data science, management and sustainability while also exploring sustainable business opportunities to broaden my background.

I am motivated to contribute to (team) success through hard work, attention to detail, and excellent communication skills. I have several years of experience in customer service, while also having a background in sales, and marketing. In addition, I have acquired organizing and leadership skills by onboarding new colleagues and setting up events while working in IT, customer service and by planning and organizing events at Sportschool S. van den Nieuwendijk. I am motivated to learn and always up for a challenge!

After working hours, I can be found at Sportschool S. van den Nieuwendijk as a personal trainer and instructor of Karate, (kick)boxing, and Fitness for all ages. As a trainer, I provide customized, effective training programs with nutritional counseling.

name: Niel de Jong
skills: ['Ecology', 'Water', 'Ecohydrology', 'Urban Ecohydrology', 'Sustainability', 'Remote sensing', 'Population Dynamics', 'Marine Biology', 'Dutch', 'English', 'Qualitative Research', 'Quantitative Research', 'Presentations', 'Academic Writing', 'Tutoring', 'Teaching']
summary:
I believe that water is an ideal medium to enhance system thinking. Water is central to everybody, for direct consumption, food, energy, hygiene, safety, and the balance of our ecosystems. And these water services need to be shared. I want to help create a world where we understand our interdependences, where we strengthen each other’s livelihoods in a sustainable way, creating peace rather than conflict, on the short and the long term, using holistic water management as a paradigm.  
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I have a MSc. in Ecohydrology. I have worked on multiple projects and policies in the Netherlands, Poland, and Brazil using an intergrative (eco)system approach, involving hydrology, ecology, hydraulics, remote sensing, and GIS. I have worked in the public and humanitarian sector. Since 2020, I am working as a policy advisor at the Hoogheemraadschap Hollands Noorderkwartier, a Dutch water board. 

In addition to my job, I am an active member of the Water Youth Network and Wetskills. I believe youth should be better represented at international water events and stages, because 1. we can make new connections, 2. we bring innovations, 3. we bring motivation and energy, and 4. we are the stakeholder of the future.
